sections.markdown:
# Biz Events
* Create a Biz Events Notebook to Analyze Trading Volume
* Add data to Dashboard
* Explore example Biz Event Dashboards and Notebooks

# What are BizEvents?
BizEvents are data points that can come from the OneAgent, RUM, or external tools. These data points can be related to any application or industry 
to help provide a better understanding from a business point of view

Business and IT teams are often looking at two different pictures, but with the pace of business changing and requiring faster decision-making, this is no longer sustainable.

Here we are drilling into the specific data points but we are able to use these points to build out Business Flow to understand where users
are dropping off or having an increase in frustrating experiences

# Exercise 1
1. Fetch all BizEvents
2. Filter by Event Type

sections.markdown:
# Exercise 4
1. Count number of buy events by accountId
2. Multiply purchase by current stock price of $12 to get the total trade amount
3. Identify the accounts with the highest trade values and how many big trades they made (Count the trades over 40 dollars by accountId)

# Exercise 5
1. Identify JSON Data and set fields
2. Expand JSON Object
3. Pull names and format them
4. Pull names and totals from products
5. Summarize totals by Name

sections.title: Exercise 5.1 - Identify JSON Data and set fields

input.value:
data json: """ [{"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"test product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative Name","quantity":10,"price":20,"total":200}]},{"firstName":"Jane","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"prod product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative LastName","quantity":15,"price":200,"total":3000}]}] """
| fields products, firstName, lastName
| expand products

grail.canonicalQuery:
data json:" [{\"firstName\":\"John\",\"lastName\":\"Doe\",\"products\":[{\"name\":\"test product\",\"quantity\":5,\"price\":10,\"total\":50},{\"name\":\"Creative Name\",\"quantity\":10,\"price\":20,\"total\":200}]},{\"firstName\":\"Jane\",\"lastName\":\"Doe\",\"products\":[{\"name\":\"prod product\",\"quantity\":5,\"price\":10,\"total\":50},{\"name\":\"Creative LastName\",\"quantity\":15,\"price\":200,\"total\":3000}]}] "
| fields products, firstName, lastName
| expand products

data json: """ [{"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"test product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative Name","quantity":10,"price":20,"total":200}]},{"firstName":"Jane","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"prod product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative LastName","quantity":15,"price":200,"total":3000}]}] """
| fields products, firstName, lastName
| expand p = products
| fields Name = concat(firstName, " ", lastName), p

grail.canonicalQuery:
data json:" [{\"firstName\":\"John\",\"lastName\":\"Doe\",\"products\":[{\"name\":\"test product\",\"quantity\":5,\"price\":10,\"total\":50},{\"name\":\"Creative Name\",\"quantity\":10,\"price\":20,\"total\":200}]},{\"firstName\":\"Jane\",\"lastName\":\"Doe\",\"products\":[{\"name\":\"prod product\",\"quantity\":5,\"price\":10,\"total\":50},{\"name\":\"Creative LastName\",\"quantity\":15,\"price\":200,\"total\":3000}]}] "
| fields products, firstName, lastName
| expand products, alias:p
| fields {concat(firstName, " ", lastName), alias:Name}, p

sections.title: Exercise 5.3 - Pull names and format them

input.value:
data json: """ [{"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"test product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative Name","quantity":10,"price":20,"total":200}]},{"firstName":"Jane","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"prod product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative LastName","quantity":15,"price":200,"total":3000}]}] """
| fields products, firstName, lastName
| expand p = products
| fields Name = concat(firstName, " ", lastName), p[total]

| fields {concat(firstName, " ", lastName), alias:Name}, p[total]

sections.title: Exercise 5.4 - Pull names and totals from products

input.value:
data json: """ [{"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"test product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative Name","quantity":10,"price":20,"total":200}]},{"firstName":"Jane","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"prod product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative LastName","quantity":15,"price":200,"total":3000}]}] """
| fields products, firstName, lastName
| expand p = products
| fields Name = concat(firstName, " ", lastName), p
| summarize `Spent Amount` = sum(p[total]), by:{Name}

grail.canonicalQuery:
data json:" [{\"firstName\":\"John\",\"lastName\":\"Doe\",\"products\":[{\"name\":\"test product\",\"quantity\":5,\"price\":10,\"total\":50},{\"name\":\"Creative Name\",\"quantity\":10,\"price\":20,\"total\":200}]},{\"firstName\":\"Jane\",\"lastName\":\"Doe\",\"products\":[{\"name\":\"prod product\",\"quantity\":5,\"price\":10,\"total\":50},{\"name\":\"Creative LastName\",\"quantity\":15,\"price\":200,\"total\":3000}]}] "
| fields products, firstName, lastName
| expand products, alias:p
| fields {concat(firstName, " ", lastName), alias:Name}, p
| summarize by:{Name}, sum(p[total]), alias:`Spent Amount`
grail.query:
data json: """ [{"firstName":"John","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"test product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative Name","quantity":10,"price":20,"total":200}]},{"firstName":"Jane","lastName":"Doe","products":[{"name":"prod product","quantity":5,"price":10,"total":50},{"name":"Creative LastName","quantity":15,"price":200,"total":3000}]}] """
| fields products, firstName, lastName
| expand p = products
| fields Name = concat(firstName, " ", lastName), p
| summarize `Spent Amount` = sum(p[total]), by:{Name}
